description: A aimosAgentAnnouncement notification is emitted by the agent if it is put in or
out of operation. aimosAgentState of type AgentState indicates what actually
happens. aimosAgentAnnouncement notification has no aimosAlarmCleared
notification.
Cold Start
A aimosAgentState of snmpColdStart(1) indicates, that the agent has been started.
Already existing Sessions are invalid; requests will be responded by
authorisation errors.
The relevant alarm list entry contains aimosAlarmListAlarmID set to alarmOMC(62)
and aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem set to 8880.
Pause
A aimosAgentState of snmpPause(2) signifies that the AIMOS SNMP Agent is
proceed to pause its activity. Even though the AIMOS SNMP Agent's process
will remain active, requests will result in time outs until aimosAgentAnnouncement
with aimosAgentState set to snmpResume(3) is forwarded.
The relevant alarm list entry contains aimosAlarmListAlarmID set to alarmOMC(62)
and aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem set to 8887.
The agent is waiting a certain period of time for acknowledgements before going
in pause mode. If the agent comes back in operation, it will recognise missing
acknowledgements and continue sending out aimosAgentAnnouncement notifications
regarding the AgentState of snmpPause(2) additional to the aimosAgentAnnouncement
notifications regarding the AgentState of snmpResume(3). This may prevent the
manager from requesting a synchronisation of the alarm list due to the gap in the
sequence of notification ID's.
Resume
A aimosAgentState of snmpResume(3) signifies that the AIMOS SNMP Agent is
resuming its activity. Already existing Sessions remain valid, except they were
not used for a period longer than the one specified in aimosSessionTimeout.
The relevant alarm list entry contains aimosAlarmListAlarmID set to alarmOMC(62)
and aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem set to 8881.
Shut Down
A aimosAgentState of snmpShutDown(4) signifies that the AIMOS SNMP Agent is
about to shut down. The AIMOS SNMP Agent waits a certain time for the SNMP
Managers to be able to acknowledge this notification before actually shutting down.
If the process terminates, all Sessions are invalidated. The agent doesn't
respond to requests until aimosAgentAnnouncement with aimosAgentState set to
snmpColdStart(1) is forwarded.
The relevant alarm list entry contains aimosAlarmListAlarmID set to alarmOMC(62)
and aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem set to 8889.
If the AIMOS SNMP Agent comes back in operation, it will recognise missing
acknowledgements and continue sending out aimosAgentAnnouncement notifications
regarding the AgentState of snmpShutDown(4) additional to the
aimosAgentAnnouncement notifications regarding the AgentState of
snmpColdStart(1). This may prevent the manager from requesting a synchronisation
of the alarm list due to the gapin the sequence of notification ID's.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAgentAnnouncement AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAgentState i 1 AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1

description: This object of type SDN is the system distinguished name of the OMC which is
designated to uniquely identify this OMC within an organisation.
E.g.: The third OMC in the network supervision may have an SDN of OMC=3.
Changing the class name (preceding the equality mark) affect only the current
organisation, while changing the instance number (after the equality mark) will
affect each organisation. That's the reason, why TelCo's must not change the
instance number.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN

description: This object is a Mikom provided world-wide unique identification number of an
organisation of type OrgID.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOrgID

description: This object is an unique identifier for a trap on SNMP Agent side and is used in
alarm acknowledgement.
Even if its value is consecutive numbered on agent side, it could seem to the
SNMP Manager in such a way as if the values may be gappy. This will be regularly
the case if more than one alarm receiver is present.
This value is reset to 0 on alarm list rebuild.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID

description: This object is incremented consecutively for each notification sent out to a
particular SNMP Manager. Thus every SNMP Manager (identified by its phone book
entry) will have consecutively numbered values in all received notifications and
therefore its value can be used in order to recognise missing notifications.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
An Alarm List Resync will reset the current SNMP Managers notification ID
whereas an alarm list rebuild will reset the corresponding notification ID
of each SNMP Manager.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID

description: This object is the consecutive numbering of all alarm notifications of the
AIMOS SNMP Agent forwarded to any manager. A notification forwarded to more
than one SNMP Manager will contain identical aimosAlarmListID's.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm list ID is reset.
The alarm list ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID

description: This object's Unsigned32 value is incremented by one for each alarm notification
except aimosAlarmChanged and aimosAlarmCleared. Alarm changed notifications and
alarm clear notifications are correlated with alarm new notifications by the
aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm event ID is reset.
The alarm event ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID

description: This value indicates what the agent is about to do.
Please refer also to the DESCRIPTION clause for aimosAgentAnnouncement.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAgentState

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID

description: The aimosAlarmNew notification is used when a new alarm appears. It contains
a new aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
The aimosAlarmNew notification causes the AIMOS SNMP Agent to create
- one alarm list entry per affected organisation and
- one alarm trap list entry per affected SNMP Manager
containing the values of the notification objects.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAlarmNew AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventType i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventTime s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListProbableCause i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSeverity i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrendIndication i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListLocation s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRaiseLatitude s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRaiseLongitude s EXAMPLE

variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID

variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID

description: This object of type AlarmID designates the alarm kind.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID

description: The Event Type categorises the alarm.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventType

description: This object of type VariableTime states when the alarm condition appeared or (in
the case of an aimosAlarmCleared notification) when the alarm condition is gone.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventTime

description: This object of type ProbableCause defines further qualification of an alarm than
aimosAlarmListEventType.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListProbableCause

description: This object of type SpecificProblem is a fault specific value used in order to
classify the fault situation. It provides further qualification of the alarm
than probable cause and is defined in accordance with definitions given in
ITU-T Recommendation X.733 clause 8.1.2.2.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem

description: This object of type Severity defines severity levels, which provide an
indication of how it is perceived that the capability of the managed
object has been affected.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSeverity

description: This object of type TrendIndication specifies the current severity trend
of the managed object.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrendIndication

description: This object allows a free form text description to be reported.
It contains a formatted description of the alarm and, should the
occasion arise, includes alarm values.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText

description: The System Distinguished Name uniquely identifies the unit within the system
controlled by the OMC.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's TrapInfo
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Component Name
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Location
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListLocation

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Unique System ID
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID

description: this object was introduced in V 2.6.0 and states the Network Elements Latitude
to the time the alarm was raised.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRaiseLatitude

description: this object was introduced in V 2.6.0 and states the Network Elements Longitude
to the time the alarm was raised.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRaiseLongitude

description: The aimosAlarmChanged notification is used when the severity of an uncleared
alarm has changed. The alarm is correlated with the aimosAlarmNew notification
by identical values in aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
The aimosAlarmChanged notification causes the AIMOS SNMP Agent to create
- one alarm list entry per affected organisation and
- one alarm trap list entry per affected SNMP Manager
containing the values of the notifications objects.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAlarmChanged AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventType i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventTime s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListProbableCause i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSeverity i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrendIndication i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListLocation s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1

variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Component Name
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Location

variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID

description: The aimosAlarmCleared notification is used when an alarm gets cleared. The alarm
is correlated with the aimosAlarmNew and aimosAlarmCleared notification by
identical values in aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
It has an additional object aimosAlarmListClearReason. In contrast to
aimosAlarmNew and aimosAlarmCleared the alarm notification object
aimosAlarmListEventTime contains the time when the alarm condition is cleared.
The aimosAlarmCleared notification causes the AIMOS SNMP Agent to
- create a new alarm trap list entry containing the values of the notification
objects
- but not to create a new alarm list entry.
Instead, the agent makes some amendments to the alarm list. Its entries created
for the aimosAlarmNew and if applicable aimosAlarmChanged notifications
(correlated with the aimosAlarmCleared notification by identical values in
aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID) are modified in the following manner:
- the notifications value of aimosAlarmListClearReason is assigned to the alarm
lists value of aimosAlarmListClearReason
- the notifications value of aimosAlarmListEventTime is assigned to the alarm
lists value of aimosAlarmListClearTime
After a aimosAlarmCleared notification was acknowledged all information of the
alarm trap table entries and the alarm list entries are combined and filed in a
new alarm log table entry. In this process, the entry from the alarm trap table
is always deleted. The alarm list entry is also deleted, if no acknowledgement
of another SNMP Manager of the according organisation is missing.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAlarmCleared AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventType i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListEventTime s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListProbableCause i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSeverity i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrendIndication i 0 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogTrapInfo s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogComponentName s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogLocation s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogUniqueSystemID s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListClearReason i 0 AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogRaiseLatitude s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogRaiseLongitude s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogClearLatitude s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogClearLongitude s EXAMPLE

variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogTrapInfo

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogComponentName

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogLocation

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogUniqueSystemID

description: This OID gives information weather the alarm was cleared or not.
If an alarm does not become automatically cleared (aimosAlarmClearMode
is set to manualClear), manualCleared is the only writeable value
(besides aimosAlarmListRecognitionState).
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListClearReason

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogRaiseLatitude

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogRaiseLongitude

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogClearLatitude

description: See corresponding description in aimosAlarmListTable.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmLogClearLongitude

description: The aimosAlarmListRebuildInitiated notification is sent, when an alarm list
rebuild process was triggered. The notification will be emitted prior to the
rebuild, immediately after dropping the content of the alarm table.
On reception of this notification, the SNMP Manager shall clean the internal
alarm table to be synchronised with the agent prior to acknowledge this
notification. Before acknowledgement the agent will not send any notification
(expect of re-send this notification by the AIMOS SNMP Agent until
acknowledgement is received by the AIMOS SNMP Agent).
The alarm list contains one entry with
- aimosAlarmListID and aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID set to 1
- aimosAlarmListAlarmID set to alarmOMC(62)
- aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem set to 8885.
The alarm trap list contains one entry per affected SNMP Manager (alarm
recipient) with
- aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID set to 1 for each SNMP Manager
- aimosAlarmTrapID set to 1 for the first SNMP Manager, 2 for the second, ...
There is no aimosAlarmCleared-notification for this alarm. It is cleared by
acknowledgement.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRebuildInitiated AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1

description: This object of type SDN is the system distinguished name of the OMC which is
designated to uniquely identify this OMC within an organisation.
E.g.: The third OMC in the network supervision may have an SDN of OMC=3.
Changing the class name (preceding the equality mark) affect only the current
organisation, while changing the instance number (after the equality mark) will
affect each organisation. That's the reason, why TelCo's must not change the
instance number.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN

description: This object is a Mikom provided world-wide unique identification number of an
organisation of type OrgID.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOrgID

description: This object is an unique identifier for a trap on SNMP Agent side and is used in
alarm acknowledgement.
Even if its value is consecutive numbered on agent side, it could seem to the
SNMP Manager in such a way as if the values may be gappy. This will be regularly
the case if more than one alarm receiver is present.
This value is reset to 0 on alarm list rebuild.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID

description: This object is incremented consecutively for each notification sent out to a
particular SNMP Manager. Thus every SNMP Manager (identified by its phone book
entry) will have consecutively numbered values in all received notifications and
therefore its value can be used in order to recognise missing notifications.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
An Alarm List Resync will reset the current SNMP Managers notification ID
whereas an alarm list rebuild will reset the corresponding notification ID
of each SNMP Manager.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID

description: This object is the consecutive numbering of all alarm notifications of the
AIMOS SNMP Agent forwarded to any manager. A notification forwarded to more
than one SNMP Manager will contain identical aimosAlarmListID's.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm list ID is reset.
The alarm list ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID

description: This object's Unsigned32 value is incremented by one for each alarm notification
except aimosAlarmChanged and aimosAlarmCleared. Alarm changed notifications and
alarm clear notifications are correlated with alarm new notifications by the
aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm event ID is reset.
The alarm event ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID

description: The aimosHeartbeat notification is sent out each [aimosWorkShiftHeartbeatInterval]
minutes to the members of the Alarm Recipient List specified by the object
[aimosWorkShiftHeartbeatRecipientList]. This notification must not be acknowledged
even if the SNMP Manager performs acknowledgement to all other notifications.
Additionally, this notifications are neither inserted to the Alarm Table nor to
the Alarm Log. Therefore this notification contains no continuous numbering.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosHeartbeat AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosCurrentTime s EXAMPLE

description: This object of type SDN is the system distinguished name of the OMC which is
designated to uniquely identify this OMC within an organisation.
E.g.: The third OMC in the network supervision may have an SDN of OMC=3.
Changing the class name (preceding the equality mark) affect only the current
organisation, while changing the instance number (after the equality mark) will
affect each organisation. That's the reason, why TelCo's must not change the
instance number.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN

description: This object of type VariableTime is used in heartbeat notifications and states
the heartbeat notifications event time.
This object also states the current time of the AIMOS SNMP Agent.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosCurrentTime

description: The aimosAlarmRecognized alarm is raised in case an alarm is recognized
- either via aimosAlarmListRecognitionState
- by means of the AIMOS_VIsu program
The description for aimosAlarmListRecognitionState provides more
information about this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIMOS::aimosAlarmRecognized AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosOrgID u 200000 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID i 1 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem u 9999 AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListLocation s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRecognitionUser s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRecognitionTime s EXAMPLE AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1

description: This object of type SDN is the system distinguished name of the OMC which is
designated to uniquely identify this OMC within an organisation.
E.g.: The third OMC in the network supervision may have an SDN of OMC=3.
Changing the class name (preceding the equality mark) affect only the current
organisation, while changing the instance number (after the equality mark) will
affect each organisation. That's the reason, why TelCo's must not change the
instance number.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOMCSDN

description: This object is a Mikom provided world-wide unique identification number of an
organisation of type OrgID.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosOrgID

description: This object is an unique identifier for a trap on SNMP Agent side and is used in
alarm acknowledgement.
Even if its value is consecutive numbered on agent side, it could seem to the
SNMP Manager in such a way as if the values may be gappy. This will be regularly
the case if more than one alarm receiver is present.
This value is reset to 0 on alarm list rebuild.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapID

description: This object is incremented consecutively for each notification sent out to a
particular SNMP Manager. Thus every SNMP Manager (identified by its phone book
entry) will have consecutively numbered values in all received notifications and
therefore its value can be used in order to recognise missing notifications.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
An Alarm List Resync will reset the current SNMP Managers notification ID
whereas an alarm list rebuild will reset the corresponding notification ID
of each SNMP Manager.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmTrapNotificationID

description: This object is the consecutive numbering of all alarm notifications of the
AIMOS SNMP Agent forwarded to any manager. A notification forwarded to more
than one SNMP Manager will contain identical aimosAlarmListID's.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm list ID is reset.
The alarm list ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListID

description: This object's Unsigned32 value is incremented by one for each alarm notification
except aimosAlarmChanged and aimosAlarmCleared. Alarm changed notifications and
alarm clear notifications are correlated with alarm new notifications by the
aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID.
When an alarm list rebuild is initiated by a SNMP Manager then the
alarm event ID is reset.
The alarm event ID is not reset, if a SNMP Manager starts an Alarm List Resync.
The wrap value is 2^32-1.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmEventID

description: This object of type AlarmID designates the alarm kind.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAlarmID

description: This object of type SpecificProblem is a fault specific value used in order to
classify the fault situation. It provides further qualification of the alarm
than probable cause and is defined in accordance with definitions given in
ITU-T Recommendation X.733 clause 8.1.2.2.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSpecificProblem

description: This object allows a free form text description to be reported.
It contains a formatted description of the alarm and, should the
occasion arise, includes alarm values.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListAdditionalText

description: The System Distinguished Name uniquely identifies the unit within the system
controlled by the OMC.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListSDN

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's TrapInfo
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListTrapInfo

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Component Name
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListComponentName

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Location
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListLocation

description: This OID contains the Network Elements's Unique System ID
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListUniqueSystemID

description: This object indicates the user who has recognized the alarm.
This object is empty if the alarm is not recognized at all.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRecognitionUser

description: This object of type VariableTime holds the time of recognition.
This object is empty if the alarm is not recognized at all.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAlarmListRecognitionTime

description: This object comprises the OID, the value of which must be set to acknowledged(2)
in order to confirm the alarm reception (i.e. perform the acknowledgement).
If a SNMP Manager is not able to perform an acknowledgement, it should set
aimosPhoneBookAckCapability to false.
variables.name: AIMOS::aimosAcknowledgementOID
